segment.source: Create Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps with intuitive and distinctive user interaction experiences that are optimized for touchpad but are functionally consistent across input devices.
segment.target: Create Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps with intuitive and distinctive user interaction experiences that are optimized for touchpad but are functionally consistent across input devices.

segment.source: Touchpad interactions
segment.target: Touchpad interactions

segment.source: Touchpad design guidelines
segment.target: Touchpad design guidelines

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: Design your app so that users can interact with it through a touchpad.
segment.target: Design your app so that users can interact with it through a touchpad.

segment.source: A touchpad combines both indirect multi-touch input with the precision input of a pointing device, such as a mouse.
segment.target: A touchpad combines both indirect multi-touch input with the precision input of a pointing device, such as a mouse.

segment.source: This combination makes the touchpad suited to both a touch-optimized UI and the smaller targets of productivity apps.
segment.target: This combination makes the touchpad suited to both a touch-optimized UI and the smaller targets of productivity apps.

segment.source: touchpad
segment.target: touchpad

segment.source: Touchpad interactions require three things:
segment.target: Touchpad interactions require three things:

segment.source: A standard touchpad or a Windows Precision Touchpad.
segment.target: A standard touchpad or a Windows Precision Touchpad.

segment.source: Precision touchpads are optimized for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) devices.
segment.target: Precision touchpads are optimized for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) devices.

segment.source: They enable the system to handle certain aspects of the touchpad experience natively, such as finger tracking and palm detection, for a more consistent experience across devices.
segment.target: They enable the system to handle certain aspects of the touchpad experience natively, such as finger tracking and palm detection, for a more consistent experience across devices.

segment.source: The direct contact of one or more fingers on the touchpad.
segment.target: The direct contact of one or more fingers on the touchpad.

segment.source: Movement of the touch contacts (or lack thereof, based on a time threshold).
segment.target: Movement of the touch contacts (or lack thereof, based on a time threshold).

segment.source: The input data provided by the touchpad sensor can be:
segment.target: The input data provided by the touchpad sensor can be:

segment.source: Interpreted as a physical gesture for direct manipulation of one or more UI elements (such as panning, rotating, resizing, or moving).
segment.target: Interpreted as a physical gesture for direct manipulation of one or more UI elements (such as panning, rotating, resizing, or moving).

segment.source: In contrast, interacting with an element through its properties window or other dialog box is considered indirect manipulation.
segment.target: In contrast, interacting with an element through its properties window or other dialog box is considered indirect manipulation.

segment.source: Recognized as an alternative input method, such as mouse or pen.
segment.target: Recognized as an alternative input method, such as mouse or pen.

segment.source: Used to complement or modify aspects of other input methods, such as smudging an ink stroke drawn with a pen.
segment.target: Used to complement or modify aspects of other input methods, such as smudging an ink stroke drawn with a pen.

segment.source: A touchpad combines indirect multi-touch input with the precision input of a pointing device, such as a mouse.
segment.target: A touchpad combines indirect multi-touch input with the precision input of a pointing device, such as a mouse.

segment.source: This combination makes the touchpad suited to both touch-optimized UI and the typically smaller targets of productivity apps and the desktop environment.
segment.target: This combination makes the touchpad suited to both touch-optimized UI and the typically smaller targets of productivity apps and the desktop environment.

segment.source: Optimize your Windows Store app design for touch input and get touchpad support by default.
segment.target: Optimize your Windows Store app design for touch input and get touchpad support by default.

segment.source: Because of the convergence of interaction experiences supported by touchpads, we recommend using the PointerEntered event to provide mouse-style UI commands in addition to the built-in support for touch input.
segment.target: Because of the convergence of interaction experiences supported by touchpads, we recommend using the PointerEntered event to provide mouse-style UI commands in addition to the built-in support for touch input.

segment.source: For example, use previous and next buttons to let users flip through pages of content as well as pan through the content.
segment.target: For example, use previous and next buttons to let users flip through pages of content as well as pan through the content.

segment.source: The gestures and guidelines discussed in this topic can help to ensure that your app supports touchpad input seamlessly and with minimal code.
segment.target: The gestures and guidelines discussed in this topic can help to ensure that your app supports touchpad input seamlessly and with minimal code.

segment.source: The touchpad language
segment.target: The touchpad language

segment.source: A concise set of touchpad interactions are used consistently throughout the system.
segment.target: A concise set of touchpad interactions are used consistently throughout the system.

segment.source: Optimize your app for touch and mouse input and this language makes your app feel instantly familiar for your users, increasing their confidence and making your app easier to learn and use.
segment.target: Optimize your app for touch and mouse input and this language makes your app feel instantly familiar for your users, increasing their confidence and making your app easier to learn and use.

segment.source: Users can set far more Precision Touchpad gestures and interaction behaviors than they can for a standard touchpad.
segment.target: Users can set far more Precision Touchpad gestures and interaction behaviors than they can for a standard touchpad.

segment.source: These two images show the different touchpad settings pages from Settings Devices Mouse & touchpad for a standard touchpad and a Precision Touchpad, respectively.
segment.target: These two images show the different touchpad settings pages from Settings Devices Mouse & touchpad for a standard touchpad and a Precision Touchpad, respectively.

segment.source: standard touchpad settings
segment.target: standard touchpad settings

segment.source: Standard\\ touchpad\\ settings
segment.target: Standard\\ touchpad\\ settings

segment.source: windows precision touchpad settings
segment.target: windows precision touchpad settings

segment.source: Windows\\ Precision\\ Touchpad\\ settings
segment.target: Windows\\ Precision\\ Touchpad\\ settings

segment.source: Here are some examples of touchpad-optimized gestures for performing common tasks.
segment.target: Here are some examples of touchpad-optimized gestures for performing common tasks.

segment.source: Term
segment.target: Term

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Three-finger tap
segment.target: Three-finger tap

segment.source: User preference to search with Cortana or show Action Center.
segment.target: User preference to search with Cortana or show Action Center.

segment.source: Three finger slide
segment.target: Three finger slide

segment.source: User preference to open the virtual desktop Task View, show Desktop, or switch between open apps.
segment.target: User preference to open the virtual desktop Task View, show Desktop, or switch between open apps.

segment.source: Single finger tap for primary action
segment.target: Single finger tap for primary action

segment.source: Use a single finger to tap an element and invoke its primary action (such as launching an app or executing a command).
segment.target: Use a single finger to tap an element and invoke its primary action (such as launching an app or executing a command).

segment.source: Two finger tap to right-click
segment.target: Two finger tap to right-click

segment.source: Tap with two fingers simultaneously on an element to select it and display contextual commands.
segment.target: Tap with two fingers simultaneously on an element to select it and display contextual commands.

segment.source: Two finger slide to pan
segment.target: Two finger slide to pan

segment.source: Slide is used primarily for panning interactions but can also be used for moving, drawing, or writing.
segment.target: Slide is used primarily for panning interactions but can also be used for moving, drawing, or writing.

segment.source: Pinch and stretch to zoom
segment.target: Pinch and stretch to zoom

segment.source: The pinch and stretch gestures are commonly used for resizing and Semantic Zoom.
segment.target: The pinch and stretch gestures are commonly used for resizing and Semantic Zoom.

segment.source: Single finger press and slide to rearrange
segment.target: Single finger press and slide to rearrange

segment.source: Drag an element.
segment.target: Drag an element.

segment.source: Single finger press and slide to select text
segment.target: Single finger press and slide to select text

segment.source: Press within selectable text and slide to select it.
segment.target: Press within selectable text and slide to select it.

segment.source: Double-tap to select a word.
segment.target: Double-tap to select a word.

segment.source: Left and right click zone
segment.target: Left and right click zone

segment.source: Emulate the left and right button functionality of a mouse device.
segment.target: Emulate the left and right button functionality of a mouse device.

segment.source: Hardware
segment.target: Hardware

segment.source: Query the mouse device capabilities (MouseCapabilities) to identify what aspects of your app UI the touchpad hardware can access directly.
segment.target: Query the mouse device capabilities (MouseCapabilities) to identify what aspects of your app UI the touchpad hardware can access directly.

segment.source: We recommend providing UI for both touch and mouse input.
segment.target: We recommend providing UI for both touch and mouse input.

segment.source: For more info about querying device capabilities, see Identify input devices.
segment.target: For more info about querying device capabilities, see Identify input devices.

segment.source: Visual feedback
segment.target: Visual feedback

segment.source: When a touchpad cursor is detected (through move or hover events), show mouse-specific UI to indicate functionality exposed by the element.
segment.target: When a touchpad cursor is detected (through move or hover events), show mouse-specific UI to indicate functionality exposed by the element.

segment.source: If the touchpad cursor doesn't move for a certain amount of time, or if the user initiates a touch interaction, make the touchpad UI gradually fade away.
segment.target: If the touchpad cursor doesn't move for a certain amount of time, or if the user initiates a touch interaction, make the touchpad UI gradually fade away.

segment.source: This keeps the UI clean and uncluttered.
segment.target: This keeps the UI clean and uncluttered.

segment.source: Don't use the cursor for hover feedback, the feedback provided by the element is sufficient (see Cursors below).
segment.target: Don't use the cursor for hover feedback, the feedback provided by the element is sufficient (see Cursors below).

segment.source: Don't display visual feedback if an element doesn't support interaction (such as static text).
segment.target: Don't display visual feedback if an element doesn't support interaction (such as static text).

segment.source: Don't use focus rectangles with touchpad interactions.
segment.target: Don't use focus rectangles with touchpad interactions.

segment.source: Reserve these for keyboard interactions.
segment.target: Reserve these for keyboard interactions.

segment.source: Display visual feedback concurrently for all elements that represent the same input target.
segment.target: Display visual feedback concurrently for all elements that represent the same input target.

segment.source: For more general guidance about visual feedback, see Guidelines for visual feedback.
segment.target: For more general guidance about visual feedback, see Guidelines for visual feedback.

segment.source: Cursors
segment.target: Cursors

segment.source: A set of standard cursors is available for a touchpad pointer.
segment.target: A set of standard cursors is available for a touchpad pointer.

segment.source: These are used to indicate the primary action of an element.
segment.target: These are used to indicate the primary action of an element.

segment.source: Each standard cursor has a corresponding default image associated with it.
segment.target: Each standard cursor has a corresponding default image associated with it.

segment.source: The user or an app can replace the default image associated with any standard cursor at any time.
segment.target: The user or an app can replace the default image associated with any standard cursor at any time.

segment.source: Windows Store apps specify a cursor image through the PointerCursor function.
segment.target: Windows Store apps specify a cursor image through the PointerCursor function.

segment.source: If you need to customize the mouse cursor:
segment.target: If you need to customize the mouse cursor:

segment.source: Always use the arrow cursor (
segment.target: Always use the arrow cursor (

segment.source: arrow cursor
segment.target: arrow cursor

segment.source: ) for clickable elements.
segment.target: ) for clickable elements.

segment.source: don't use the pointing hand cursor (
segment.target: don't use the pointing hand cursor (

segment.source: pointing hand cursor
segment.target: pointing hand cursor

segment.source: ) for links or other interactive elements.
segment.target: ) for links or other interactive elements.

segment.source: Instead, use hover effects (described earlier).
segment.target: Instead, use hover effects (described earlier).

segment.source: Use the text cursor (
segment.target: Use the text cursor (

segment.source: text cursor
segment.target: text cursor

segment.source: ) for selectable text.
segment.target: ) for selectable text.

segment.source: Use the move cursor (
segment.target: Use the move cursor (

segment.source: move cursor
segment.target: move cursor

segment.source: ) when moving is the primary action (such as dragging or cropping).
segment.target: ) when moving is the primary action (such as dragging or cropping).

segment.source: Don't use the move cursor for elements where the primary action is navigation (such as Start tiles).
segment.target: Don't use the move cursor for elements where the primary action is navigation (such as Start tiles).

segment.source: Use the horizontal, vertical and diagonal resize cursors (
segment.target: Use the horizontal, vertical and diagonal resize cursors (

segment.source: vertical resize cursor
segment.target: vertical resize cursor

segment.source: horizontal resize cursor
segment.target: horizontal resize cursor

segment.source: diagonal resize cursor (lower left, upper right)
segment.target: diagonal resize cursor (lower left, upper right)

segment.source: diagonal resize cursor (upper left, lower right)
segment.target: diagonal resize cursor (upper left, lower right)

segment.source: ), when an object is resizable.
segment.target: ), when an object is resizable.

segment.source: Use the grasping hand cursors (
segment.target: Use the grasping hand cursors (

segment.source: grasping hand cursor (open)
segment.target: grasping hand cursor (open)

segment.source: grasping hand cursor (closed)
segment.target: grasping hand cursor (closed)

segment.source: ) when panning content within a fixed canvas (such as a map).
segment.target: ) when panning content within a fixed canvas (such as a map).
